name: Cleopatra's Caesar Salad
recipeCategory: dinner, easy, quick, salads and dressings
keywords: anchovy fillets, parmigiano-reggiano, romaine, main course
recipeIngredient: 3 to 4 slices sourdough bread, cut 1/2 inch thick
2 flat anchovy fillets, drained, dried and minced
20 cups romaine lettuce torn into bite-size pieces (2 or 3 heads)

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the bread on both sides with nonstick spray; then rub with the cut side of several garlic cloves, reserving 1 clove for the dressing. Toast the bread for about 10 minutes, on the bottom shelf of the oven, until brown, turning once.
Spoon the grated cheese into a small bowl. Stir in the buttermilk, and blend well.
Mince 1 clove of garlic, and add to the mixture with mustard, lemon juice, Worcestershire, anchovies, parsley, salt and pepper, whisk to blend.
For each salad, mix together 1/4 of the croutons with 5 cups of romaine and 1/4 of the salad dressing, and toss.
